definition: an opening deliberately made in or through something, make holes in
details:
noun
- an opening deliberately made in or through something
- one playing period, from tee to green, on a golf course
= example: one playing period, from tee to green, on a golf course
= synonyms: golf hole
- informal terms for the mouth
= synonyms: trap
- an opening into or through something
- a depression hollowed out of solid matter
= synonyms: hollow
- an unoccupied space
- informal terms for a difficult situation
= synonyms: fix
- a fault or problem
= example: a fault or problem
verb
- make holes in
- hit the ball into the hole
= synonyms: hole out
